definition: bladder 氣|气[qi4] transformation in TCM
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
illness having to do with obstruction of urine flow/(Chinese medicine)/retention of urine
bodily fluids (general term in Chinese medicine)
(TCM) the three truncal cavities (thoracic, abdominal and pelvic), known as the "triple heater" or "San Jiao"
blocked or painful urination, constipation and vomiting (Chinese medicine)
wuling powder (decoction of poria mushroom used in TCM)/poria five powder/Hoelen five powder/five ling powder
(in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
